response: I'm truly sorry to hear that you're feeling this way. It takes courage to share your feelings with someone, so thank you for opening up about it. If these feelings are persistent or overwhelming, talking to a trusted person who can provide support might be beneficial. Additionally, maintaining routines like regular meals and exercise could help improve how you feel day-to-day. Remember that seeking professional guidance is always an option if things become too much to handle alone. Your wellbeing matters greatly!

[Professional Therapist Response]
feelings of hopelessness, that's different. First step, identify your own symptoms of depression. If you have any thoughts of hurting yourself, tell someone. If you're not sure, you can try 800-lifenet or other support line to get feedback. First aid for depression includes: daily care and feeding, good sleeping and eating, lots of exercise--even when you don't feel like it-- healthy socializing, and focusing on talking to yourself in a positive way.

[Professional Therapist Response]
yourself in a positive way. If you aren't able to move yourself out of your depression,  work with a professional to make short-term goals and get some support. You may also talk to your doctor or psychiatrist about trying an anti-depressant to give you a little lift while you go through a rough patch.Best wishes,Karen
